alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 18 at 4:34AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves will build to 7 to 10 feet this evening, peak at 10 to 13 feet with local sets to 16 feet Thursday and Thursday night, then subside slowly late Thursday night and Friday morning. There will also be a high risk of dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
